nodes.name: Definition of planning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a g s) (iff (planning e a g s) (and (ecsSeq' e s a)(goal g a)(planseq s a g))))
nodes.english: The activity of planning is an agent's sequence of envisionments of a causal system that is a plan for achieving one of the agent's goals. The expression (planning e a g s) says that e is an activity by agent a to plan to achieve goal g, where s is the sequence of plans produced by this activity.

nodes.name: Planning as subevent of goal pursuit
nodes.fol: (forall (e0 a g) (if (pursueGoal' e0 a g) (exists (e s) (and (planning e a g s)(subevent e e0)))))
nodes.english: Goal pursuit has planning as a subevent.

nodes.name: Human planning ability
nodes.fol: (forall (a g) (if (and (person a)(goal g a)) (exists (e s c)(and (able a e c)(planning e a g s)))))
nodes.english: People have an ability to construct, adapt, and modify plans. Planning activity includes all types of planning, including plan adaptation, reactive planning, and constructing elaborate plans from scratch.

nodes.name: Definition of collaborativePlanning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a1 a2 g s) (iff (collaborativePlanning e a1 a2 g s) (exists (e1 e2 s1 s2) (and (planning e1 a1 g s1)(planning e2 a2 g s2) (and' e e1 e2)(doubleton a a1 a2)(goal g a) (forall (p) (iff (inSeq p s) (or (inSeq p s1)(inSeq p s2))))))))
nodes.english: Collaborative planning activity by agents a1 and a2 is the conjunction of a1's planning to achieve goal g and a2's planning to achieve the same goal g, where the set consisting of a1 and a2 has g as a collective goal. Moreover, the plans in the joint sequence of plans come from one of the agents or the other.

nodes.name: Definition of assistivePlanning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a1 a2 g s) (iff (assistivePlanning e a1 a2 g s) (exists (e1 e2 g1 s1 s2) (and (planning e1 a1 g1 s1)(planning e2 a2 g s2) (and' e e1 e2)(subgoal g1 g) (forall (p) (iff (inSeq p s) (or (and (assistivePlan p a1 a2 g) (inSeq p s1)) (inSeq p s2))))))))
nodes.english: Assistive planning is a slightly weaker notion. Here agent a1, who is assisting agent a2, does not necessarily have the goal that both agents achieve goal g, but only that agent a2 achieves g. Agent a1 is satisfied to accomplish a subgoal g1 of g.

nodes.name: Definition of competitivePlanning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a1 a2 g s) (iff (competitivePlanning e a1 a2 g s) (exists (e1 e2 s1 s2) (and (planning e1 a1 g s1)(planning e2 a2 g s2) (and' e e1 e2) (forall (p) (iff (inSeq p s) (or (and (competitivePlan p a1 a2 g) (inSeq p s1)) (and (competitivePlan p a2 a1 g) (inSeq p s2)))))))))
nodes.english: Two agents can also be opposed in their efforts. Competitive planning is where two agents work toward goals that cannot both occur at once.

nodes.name: Definition of adversarialPlanning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a1 a2 g s) (iff (adversarialPlanning e a1 a2 g s) (exists (e1 e2 s1 s2 g1) (and (planning e1 a1 g1 s1)(planning e2 a2 g s2) (and' e e1 e2)(not' g1 g) (forall (p) (iff (inSeq p s) (or (and (adversarialPlan p a1 a2 g) (inSeq p s1)) (inSeq p s2))))))))
nodes.english: Adversarial planning is a stronger notion than competitive planning. It is when one agent a1 has as an active plan that another agent a2 not achieve a goal g.

nodes.name: Definition of counterPlanning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a1 a2 g s) (iff (counterPlanning e a1 a2 g s) (exists (p2 g1) (and (plan p2 a2 g)(planning e a1 g1 s)(not' g1 g) (forall (p) (if (inSeq p s)(counterplan p p2 a1 a2 g)))))))
nodes.english: A stronger notion still is when active counterplanning goes on. Agent a1 tries to figure out a2's plan, and then tries to block its success. We can model this by saying that a1 strives to achieve (not g2) where g2 is a subgoal of a2's ultimate goal.

nodes.name: Definition of counterfactualSubgoal
nodes.fol: (forall (g1 g2 a) (iff (counterfactualSubgoal g1 g2 a) (and (subgoal g1 g2)(not g1) (not (exists (e s) (planning e a g1 s))))))
nodes.english: A counterfactual subgoal is one that does not hold and the agent engages in no planning to make it hold.

nodes.name: Definition of counterfactualPlanning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a g1 g2 s) (iff (counterfactualPlanning e a g1 g2 s) (exists (p) (and (planning e a g2 s)(last p s)(subgoalIn g1 p) (counterfactualSubgoal g1 g2 a)))))
nodes.english: Counterfactual planning occurs when there is a counterfactual subgoal in the last plan in the sequence of plans that the planning activity produces.

nodes.name: Definition of otherPersonPlanning
nodes.fol: (forall (e a1 a2 g1 g2 s) (iff (otherPersonPlanning e a1 a2 g1 g2 s) (and (counterfactualPlanning e a g1 g2 s) (exists (g3) (and (subst a2 g3 a1 g1)(Rexist g3))))))
nodes.english: A particularly common kind of counterfactual planning is imagining what we would do if we were a different person. The expression (otherPersonPlanning e a1 a2 g1 g2 s) says that e is the activity of agent a1 planning as though property g1, a property of a1, were true, even though it isn't, where the corresponding property g3 of a2 is true.

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
